intro: Stenodraba imbricatifolia var. glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous leafed stenodraba, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are typically hairless, giving it its varietal name "glabrata." Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
